intro: Pfaffia townsendii, commonly known as curcuma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are often overlooked despite their medicinal potential. Its rhizomes are rich in bioactive compounds, including curcuminoids, which have been studied for their anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. Pfaffia townsendii is often cultivated for both ornamental and traditional medicinal purposes.
